thread.title: Rutgers WR Carroo returns to practice after charges dropped
thread.title_full: Rutgers WR Carroo returns to practice after charges dropped

title: Rutgers WR Carroo returns to practice after charges dropped
text:
Rutgers WR Carroo returns to practice after charges dropped By -   
PISCATAWAY, N.J. (AP) - Leonte Carroo says he is well aware of how lucky he is to be back on the football field. 
The Rutgers receiver returned to practice Thursday after charges that he attacked a woman he used to date after a game Sept. 12 were dropped. 
Coach Kyle Flood reinstated Carroo on Wedensday, a day after a judge dismissed simple assault charges. 
Carroo declined to get into details of the incident. There are still simple assault charges pending against the woman and others, including Carroo’s girlfriend and mother. 
A Piscataway municipal court judge dismissed the charges against Carroo when the woman said she didn’t want to testify against him. That came hours after another judge lifted a temporary restraining order because the woman said she didn’t think it was necessary. 
Rutgers host No. 4 Michigan State on Saturday night.
